q1.q: 1. How does a program store user input?
q1.a1: You use a variable to store a particular piece of data
q1.a2: You enter the data then press the enter button to store it
q1.a3: All data is stored within a single variable called 'input'
q1.a4: The program cannot store input, the programmer must write it down by hand on a piece of paper
q1.answer: You use a variable to store a particular piece of data

q2.q:
2. Would any errors occur for the following code? 
byte x= 1500;
q2.a1: Yes, a syntax error would occur and you can not run the program
q2.a2: No, it will proceed as normal
q2.a3: Yes, the program will still run, but there would be a runtime error
q2.a4: Yes, it is a logic error
q2.answer: Yes, a syntax error would occur and you can not run the program

q5.q: 5. What is the difference between a while loop and a do-while loop?
q5.a1: A do-while loop executes the body before testing the condition
q5.a2: A do-while loop executes the body after testing the condition
q5.a4: The do-while loop does not contain a boolean
q5.answer: A do-while loop executes the body before testing the condition
